body: FWIW, you can work around it using IndexMapping.TypeField. See Index interface documentation for details about how the document type is resolved.
Yes...that's what I ended up doing.  It was that or change my field names from Type to something else.

Yeah, I'd like to think about this and get additional input from others.  I had originally chosen the names Classifier and Type because the idea was that we index your structures, and we don't force you to clutter them with a lot of Bleve specific stuff.

But, conflicting with a Type field is a real issue to consider.  Another option would be to offer both interfaces, without explicitly deprecating Classifier.

I'll ask around today and try to get additional input, also @pmezard do you have opinion on this?

I am afraid my opinion is to avoid adding more magic, but that is not constructive.
If I had to design the API from scratch, I would do something explicit like:

```
func Index(kind string, id string, doc interface{}) error
```

and get rid of the Classifier, TypeField, etc.

I have no strong opinion about adding a BleveType(), clearly Type() is too generic.

What about running with @pmezard's option by providing an additional index method, eg:

``` go
func IndexKind(kind string, id string, doc interface{}) error
```

It's not ideal, but it does at least provide a method for people to side-step the issue where other options are infeasible.

If you were to also introduce a new classifier, I'd strongly recommend deprecating the old one so that it can be phased out, since there may also be a method conflict on `Type()`, where the return value might be unacceptable as a doc type identifier.
See f9354ec on my fork for a POC, still a breaking change (though not for most users) with the modification of the index interface, but pretty minimal surface area.

issue.title: Remove document type determination and add kind to index function

issue.title: Remove document type determination and add kind to index function

issue.title: add support for BleveType() alternative for type detection

repository.name: bleve
repository.description: A modern text/numeric/geo-spatial/vector indexing library for go

issue.body:
Many existing structs already have a Type field or method which
conflicts with the bleve Classifier interface.  To address this
without breaking existing applications, we introduce an
alternate BleveType() method which will be checked first.  The
interface describing this method is private, as it should never
need to be referenced outside this package.

fixes #283
